brief_summary.textblock:
RATIONALE: Studying samples of blood or tumor tissue from patients with cancer in the
      laboratory may help doctors identify and learn more about biomarkers related to cancer.

      PURPOSE: This clinical trial studies prostate-specific antigen (PSA) antibody levels in
      samples from patients treated for prostate cancer on trial ECOG-E9802.

clinical_study.brief_title: PSA Antibody Levels in Samples From Patients With Prostate Cancer Treated on Protocol ECOG-E9802

detailed_description.textblock:
OBJECTIVES:

      Primary

        -  To evaluate changes in prostate-specific antigen (PSA) antibody levels over time among
           patients treated on ECOG-E9802.

      Secondary

        -  To characterize the concordance of PSA antibody assessment between the ECOG Immunology
           Laboratory and the NCI Immunology Laboratory.

      OUTLINE: Previously tested samples are evaluated for changes in PSA antibody levels over
      time (from baseline to follow-up at 12 and 24 weeks) at the ECOG Immunology Laboratory and
      the NCI Immunology Laboratory. Results are compared between the laboratories.

criteria.textblock:
DISEASE CHARACTERISTICS: Samples collected on ECOG-E9802 (A Phase II Study of PROSTVAC-V
        (Vaccinia)/TRICOM and PROSTVAC-F (Fowlpox/TRICOM with GM-CSF in Patients with PSA
        Progression after Local Therapy for Prostate Cancer)

        PATIENT CHARACTERISTICS:

          -  Not specified

        PRIOR CONCURRENT THERAPY:

          -  Not specified

link.description: Clinical trial summary from the National Cancer Institute's PDQ® database

clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of PSA Antibody on E9802: Confirmation and Concordance

overall_official.affiliation: Rutgers Cancer Institute of New Jersey

primary_outcome.measure: PSA antibody levels are compared between baseline and follow-up at 12 weeks, as well as 24 weeks, using Wilcoxon signed-rank test

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: Concordance of PSA antibody assessment between the ECOG Immunology Laboratory and the NCI Immunology Laboratory; concordance correlation coefficient will be computed
